title.narrative: OPT 2.3. PREVENTION, DETECTION, REPORTING AND REFERENCE OF VIOLENCE IN THE EDUCAT

description.narrative: The education system in the four departments receiving UNICEF support have increased capacity for preventing, detecting, reporting and referring cases of violence

sector.narrative: Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The education system in the four departments receiving UNICEF support have increased capacity for preventing, detecting, reporting and referring cases of violence

description.narrative: UNICEF helped improve the regulatory framework and policies to prevent, detect and report cases of violence. Progress was also made on the generation of data on violence in schools and on expanding violence prevention training for teachers, which included production of materials and strengthening coordination between the education system and child protection services. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: # of municipalities with protocols and coordination mechanisms established between the Plurinational Educational System and the child protection services to deal with violence against boys and girls in schools, with support from UNICEF

target.value: 2022:8 municipalities: Cobija, Gonzalo Moreno, Chimore, Puerto Villaroel, Independencia, El Alto, Santa Cruz de la Sierra, Montero

title.narrative: % of schools in chosen school nucleus that implement activities to prevent violence against boys, girls and adolescents in schools, in the municipalities supported by UNICEF

target.value: 2022:100% in 8 municipalities: Cobija, Gonzalo Moreno, Chimore, Puerto Villaroel, Independencia, El Alto, Santa Cruz de la Sierra, Montero

title.narrative: System Strengthening - Gender - Existence of well-defined legal/policy frameworks to address gender based violence in and around schools - score (1-4), see guidance
